timeline.message: [FLINK-20079][task] Initialize operator chain before upstream partition request

timeline.bodyText:
Why do we need to reduce the backpressure here? I'm worried that any solution on top of it will only work with a certain minimal flow.
Note that in ef4f78d#diff-c0d448d637f04cc203de3592d7fab0ba2412f2d75c59dcf6e44cc4a3c18e5851R568 I added a modification to the test that avoids backpressuring during recovery (by applying backpressure only after the first successful checkpoint.
timeline.author: AHeise

replies.bodyText:
Why do we need to reduce the backpressure here?

This is a commit from #13827. As far as I understand, the motivation was:

to have higher backpressure (.1ms vs 1ms) for some parts of the stream
to have unbalanced streams
reduce running time (was ~1m, now ~10s)

On average, the change decreases sleep time only by 60% (1-42/1000*10).

I'm worried that any solution on top of it will only work with a certain minimal flow.

With 1K elements, the sink will sleep 23 times for 1ms, which I think is enough and 1K is a reasonable number of elements for this test.
replies.author: rkhachatryan
